projects.title: Halifax Canoe and Kayak
projects.description: Website for booking canoe and kayak adventures. Skills demonstrated in the full-stack developement and basics of dev-ops. A project for Digital Nova Scotia - Skills for Hire program.
details: Created the website as a project for booking the adventure for Canoe and Kayaking from the available trips
Designed the responsive UI using HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, JavaScript, and jQuery from the wireframe design
Developed the backend and validated the form submitted on the server side using PHP
Handled the version control using Git and GitHub for all 3-phases of the project
Launched on the AWS as Iaas, using EC2, configured LAMP Stack and RDS for the MySQL relational database
Integrated multiple Docker-container seamlessly using docker-compose, deployed the project on the DockerHub

projects.title: Nish-Foody
projects.description: A website for food ordering and selling. Skills demonstrated as a full-stack developer and documentarian for this final project spanning over 3 months.
details: Developed a fully-functional website for food ordering/selling for the people of Antigonish
Worked as a full-stack developer in SDLC as a 5-member team to create the website as the final year project
Surveyed people from different backgrounds for the requirement analysis; and spearheaded the documentation
Designed the menu page using HTML5, CSS3, and Bootstrap for the UI and the cart for orders using JS/jQuery
Adopted the Django framework serving REST API that was connected to the PostgreSQL database
Followed the Agile methodology with tools like JIRA and Confluence pages for the documentation

projects.title: Portfolio Website
projects.description: My personal website to demonstrate my skills to the world. This project demonstrates my skill as front-end developer for which I used ReactJS and ChakraUI, and hosted on Netlify.

projects.title: Tic-tac-toe
projects.description: My first mini-project in the web development area as a backend developer where I used flask microframework. I received constructive critisim on my coding style by Harvard's computer science professor Dr. David Malan in CS50's code-review stream.
details: First experience of utilizing any framework for web-development. I learned about flask micro-framework by reading the official documentation.
Implemented backend using flask, used stackoverflow/goggle to solve the issues during the developement process
First time using git for version control and hosted project on the github
Received the feedback on my project from my idol Dr. David Malan; learned about various aspect i.e., the best coding practicies,  use of MVC in the web developement, etc.

projects.title: Hotel Management
projects.description: The relational database for Hotel Room reservation / booking that is developed in 4-phases and deployed on the StFX University's Oracle server setup by the professor.
details: Developed the relational database as a 4-member team for the Hotel Management
Actively participated in creating the ERD diagram, designing and then normalizing the database
Performed CRUD operations maintaining the constraints placed on the 4/15 tables using SQL
Prepared some python scripts to generate and load a large amount of data automatically to the database
Prepared meaningful Views and useful queries on the database by applying joins on the tables
Deployed the relational database on the university's Oracle Server hosted by the professor

certificates.title: Google IT Professional Certificate
certificates.about: Completed as a part of Junior IT Analyst program of NPower Canada

certificateDetails.learnings: I learned about how to assemble a computer, basics of internet, overview of operation system and applications, problem-solving methodologies and soft-skills required in Information Technology field

certificateDetails.certName: The Bits and Bytes of Computer Networking
certificateDetails.learnings: In this course I learned basics of computer networking; five-layer and OSI model; standard protocols; network troubleshooting; basics of DNS and DHCP server

certificateDetails.certName: Operating Systems and You: Becoming a Power User
certificateDetails.learnings: I learned about Windows and Linux OS; file systems; install, configure, and remove software; disk partitioning; set up users, groups and permissions; background processes and management; troubleshoot the common issues regarding OS

certificateDetails.certName: System Administration and IT Infrastructure Services
certificateDetails.learnings: In this course I learned about chosing the best hardware and services for organizations; manage infrastructure servers; Active directory and OpenLDAP; how to backup and recover data; utilize system adminstration knowledge to plan and improve processes for IT environments

certificateDetails.certName: IT Security: Defense against the digital dark arts
certificateDetails.learnings: I learned basics of Cloud Computing; everything as a service; cloud storage; security principles and basics of ips/ids/firewall

During this professional program in addition to fundamental of IT support, I learned differnet domains of IT such as Computer Networking, Operating Systems, System Administration, Computer Security, etc.
I was rewarded this badge by Credly for completing the professional certification.

I joined NPower Canada's Junior IT Analyst program to get hands on traning in the IT field to enhance my area in the field of Computer Networking and Security to combined my work experience as a Technician. Apart from learning technical skills, I learned valuable soft skills and valuable tips about job search in the Canadian market in this field.

certificates.title: Web Development
certificates.about: Achieved this certificate as part of Skills for hire - Web development program of Digital Nova Scotia

certificateDetails.learnings: Learned about web development fundamentals; back-end developement Php, NodeJS; front-end development HTML5, CSS3, Javascript (ES6), jQuery; docker; CI/CD Basics; AWS Basics

certificates.title: Programming Competitions
certificates.about: I participated in the ICPC Programming competition representing StFX University as a part of team X-abytes-1 under the guidence of the professor Dr. Milton King.

certificateDetails.learnings: We had to apply our data strucutres and alogrithm knowledge here. I learned a lot about time-management and how to work under pressure with a team brainstroming the ideas.

We had a meeting before the competition where we were introdued the protocols to follow. During this compeition we learned about teamwork, and how to overcome the difficult problems by sharing the ideas to solve a problem and iteratively make the solution efficient.

certificates.title: Harvard Certificates
certificates.about: My first ever Computer Science introductory course. I participated in the various events of Harvard's CS50 courses, and enrolled in other courses.

certificateDetails.learnings: I learned general overview of the Computer Science field and learned building blocks like basic data strucutres, algorithm, memory management, and fundamental concepts to build my career. I learned several programming languages like scratch, c, python, html, javascript, and solved challenging assignments like recovering images, spell-checker, game of fifteen using C - langauge.

I earned this certificate for participating in the puzzle day event in 2019. I was in the team with members from Belgium, Turkey, Ukraine, and Netherlands. We were colleagues in CS50 course and coordinated using Discord platform. We are rewarded the certificate for solving 9 out of 12 puzzles.

I earned this certificate 2nd year in a row for the puzzle day online event. I participated as a one-member team to challenge myself this year for the event. I was rewarded the certificate for solving 6 out of 8 puzzles.

I took the Data Science course to get familiar with the basics of the field because I was fascinated by the Machine Learning concepts that I was introduced in the MIT 6002x course. This was my first course in a specialization of this field.

certificates.title: MIT Certificates
certificates.about: After learning basic concepts of Computer Science from Harvard's CS50 course, I was recommended this course by my peers when I was looking for recommendation for Python coruses.

certificateDetails.certName: Introduction to Computer Science and Programming Using Python
certificateDetails.learnings: A deep dive in to core computer science concepts with the help of mathematics on the parts like big-oh analysis. Apart from learning technical skills, I learned time management and stress management as this was my first instructor-paced course where I had to submit assignments and complete exams by the set deadlines.

certificateDetails.certName: Introduction to Computational Thinking and Data Science
certificateDetails.learnings: This course challenged me in a whole new way, and I decided to build my career in the Data Science / Machine Learning in the future. I learned about graph data structure and related algorithms, stochastic programming and statistical thinking, Monte-Carlo simulation, various plotting libraries, and introduction to Machine Learning with KNN.
This certificate was rewarded to me for completing X series program by completing the 6001x and 6002x courses from MIT.
I leaned about basic programming concepts like data types, variables, logic, loops, control flows, functions, etc. and got familiar with various terminologies of Java langauge.
In this course I learned abotu arrays, classes & objects, inheritance, polymorphism, abstract classes, and interfaces.

During this course I learned abuot various searching and sorting algorithms like bubble sort, selection sort, merge sort, linear search, binary search, and data structures like liked list, stack, queue.

I was rewarded this certificate for completing the series of Java coruses offered by Microsoft. During the entire program I learned how to program using Java Language and terminologies related to the programming language.

experiences.title: Customer Service Associate
responsibilities: Increased customer engagement by effectively handling queries and utilizing resources to curb wait times during peak hours, contributing to an increase in revenue generation
Delivered excellent customer service by identifying individual problems and providing solutions over emails, resulting in a significant improvement in customer satisfaction
Created quality custom macros for various customer inquiries using the Zendesk environment for the ticketing system, resulting in high productivity and a reduction in service delivery speed

experiences.title: Clerk
responsibilities: Increased Garden Center profit by 20% by upselling products and sharing information about plants, vegetables, and herbs with customers, achieving 'Department of the Week' for consistent performance improvement; also rewarded with supervisor position at times in the absense of my supervisor

Curbed losses in the Floral department by applying the skills learned in the Garden Center to arrange flowers and bouquets at the front of the store and trained the new members, often received high praise from customers by providing excellent recommendations for special occasions
Increased customer engagement in the Bulk department by rearranging the products to make them easier to find following customer needs, helping to increase sales during the festival season

experiences.title: Shipping Associate
responsibilities: Created a strong rapport with customers by executing sound judgment, patience, and active listening skills to resolve customers' shipping requirements resulting in an increased customer satisfaction rate

Demonstrated willingness to learn various skills in the copy center, work with copy center associates in the peak hours, and assist in other departments when needed justified 'Learn, Work, and Grow together' at Staples

Provided excellent services to the customer in Shipping and Copy Center by accommodating customers with their various needs and helped other departments on demand, demonstraning the teamwork, resulting in minimizing the losses of the company during the downtime

experiences.title: Cashier
responsibilities: Contributed to increasing revenue of the branch by maintaining a low waiting time during the peak hours at the drive-through by providing excellent customer service and operating the POS with a high accuracy

Contributed to the team helping in maintaining food and beverages quality by analyzing the patterns of demand of customers at different hours for the various products, which helped in diminishing the food-waste

Proved the work ethic by working during the various shifts as requested that benefited the crew members by having their time off as needed, which helped in maintaining the overall productivity of the team

experiences.title: Department Assistant
responsibilities: Applied active listening to identify client needs and the book search and selection process, resulting in high client satisfaction and gaining repeat business
Transformed the department by applying Dewey Decimal Classification (DDC) to rectify mistakes in sorting books, resulting in around 500+ books being categorized correctly in the library system
Organized newspapers and magazines by the date and time daily, resulting in increased reliability of the archival system of the library

experiences.title: Technician
responsibilities: Boosted company reputation by providing excellent technical support to customers on time as a part of the maintenance and service department for both the hardware and software team

Modernized the department for the OS installation and Software installation process by introducing new technologies and incorporating remote solutions like TeamViewer to help the customer at remote locations
Demonstrated excellent inventory management skills by tracking stock and analyzing supply and demand trends, resulting in consistent availability of products and helping increase sales

experiences.title: Freelancing Tutor
responsibilities: Provided tuition services to the university students for 'Engineering Drawing/Graphics' subject by executing the skills I learned from my previous job as lecturer; helping them understand the material thoroughly and clear the University exams
Taught Mathematics and Aptitude topics for the competitive exams; resulted in our student gaining very good score in both topics in those exams

experiences.title: Adhoc Lecturer
responsibilities: Increased student success rate by 10% in recent years in the subjects of 'Engineering Drawing/Graphics' and 'Elements of Mechanical Engineering by applying a practical approach to curriculum delivery

Contributed to the development of course material by accumulating challenging examples from various reference books, creating new problems and preparing solutions, and delivering feedback on the assignments and exams on time, resulting in a high-quality study guide for students available free of cost

Conducted extra classes for curious students on demand to engage them in practicing challenging problems and guided them in the right direction, resulting in 98% of students clearing the University exams across different streams for both subjects

volunteer.title: Community Teaching Assistant
responsibilities: Helped 100+ online learners expand their knowledge and clear their doubts of the course material, introducing alternative solution methods to challenging problems on all suporting course platforms including discussion forum
Curated and maintained the Facebook-group for the term as a moderator with Dr. Ana Bell (MIT Professor) creating a plagiarism free support group on the facebook platform for the online learners

training.institute: Digital Nova Scotia - Skills for Hire

extracurriculars.name: International Collegiate Programming Contest
extracurriculars.details: I was honored to represent StFX for the 3rd time for programming competition during my 2-year span. This was my first in-person experience of any programming competition. I was member of team X-abyes1 along with Dalon and Vijay.

extracurriculars.name: Atlantic Canada Programming Competition
extracurriculars.details: The StFX University were hosting this event online for this year. We were the only team representing our university this time. Despite our heavy course load of 6 courses in our program with some advanced courses like Machine Learning, and Theory of Computing, I was honored to participate for this event with my team members Dalon and Vijay to represent our University. We were ranked 6 out of 12 participating teams.

extracurriculars.name: Atlantic Canada Programming Competition
extracurriculars.details: I partficiated as a member of team Green representing St. Francis Xavier University. We particiapted online and connected with team via ms-team because couldn't travel due to Covid19 and we were studying online. We were ranked 4 out of 20 particiapting teams for this event.
